strings.Value: "Lay down your weapon, Ntavi. That is an order."
"Don't draw your swords yet. I'm convinced we can come to an agreement."
"Finally. I was afraid I'd die of boredom."
{n}Ntavi grins ominously, reflections of the fire dancing in her eyes.{/n} "Here I am. Did you miss me?"

"After hunting, Elina dared to raise her voice at me. And insulting a {g|Calistria}Calistria{/g} priestess is a sin that can only be washed away with blood." {n}Ntavi's voice rings through the woods.{/n} "Out of my way."
{n}Ntavi spits at your feet.{/n} "Come and get it!"
{n}Ntavi laughs .{/n} "Coward... It'll be a pleasure to kill you."
{n}Ntavi looks you in the eyes and smirks.{/n} "Shall we dance?"

"I knew you'd say that. And you showed such promise! What is this world coming to when the sacred flame of vengeance can't be lit, even in a warrior who lost his family... milk runs through your veins, not blood. I was wrong about you. Well... I promised you to the goddess, and she will get you. But as a sacrifice, not a weapon of vengeance..."
{n}Tristian's face doesn't change, but he takes a tiny step towards Elina, as though to stand between her and Ntavi.{/n}

{n}Harrim lets out a dark chuckle.{/n} "What would your giddy goddess know of sacrifice, hmm? We are all doomed to be sacrificed upon the altar of {g|Groetus}Groetus{/g}... but it seems you will have to wait for that time in the {g|Boneyard}Boneyard{/g}."
"I'm so tired of all this yakking." {n}Amiri grips her sword.{/n}
